text: Christopher Charles Amoo (born 14 October 1952) is a singer-songwriter and the lead singer of English soul group, The Real Thing. He is also a dog breeder, and judge at the dog shows including Crufts, where he had great success with his Afghan Hound, Viscount Grant. ==Background== Amoo was born on 14 October 1952 in Liverpool, England.Soulwalking the real thing He came from a mixed- race background that includes Ghanaian and Irish. His grandfather who was Ghanaian married his grandmother who was Irish. He was also the brother of Eddie Amoo, also a member of The Real Thing.The Tottenhen Independent, 8 April 2016 The Real Thing bring their 40th anniversary tour to Edmonton – Mattie Lacey-Davidson He is married to Julie Amoo née Mello. ==Music== ===The Real Thing=== As a member of The Real Thing, he had great success with "You to Me Are Everything", "Can't Get By Without You", and "Can You Feel the Force?".Joined-Up Thinking, By Stevyn Colgan Round 5, I'D RATHER HAVE A FULL BOTTLE IN FRONT OF ME... In March 1977, the song he co-wrote with brother "You'll Never Know What You're Missing" was at No 23 in the Billboard chart, having been at No. 20 the previous week.Billboard, 28 March 1977 Page 75 Billboard Hits Of The World, Britain ===Solo=== In 1981, his single "This Must Be Love", (a Phil Collins composition) b/w "You'll Never Know What You're Missing" was released on the Precision label.45cat Record Details, Chris Amoo, Catalogue: PAR 118 In March 1984, a single recorded with Debby Bishop was released on EMI. The song "No Choir of Angels" was backed with "Love Talk".45cat Record Details, Chris Amoo And Debby Bishop, Catalogue: EMI 5455 In April that year, along with Alan Price and others, he appeared on final episode of a show hosted by Marti Caine.BBC Genome Project Marti Caine, BBC Two England, 10 April 1984, ContributorsThe Glasgow Herald, Tuesday 10 April 1984 TV: Compiled by DAVID BELCHER, BBC2, 9.0 Marti Caine In 1976, he sang on early versions of "Forever Autumn" and "Thunder Child" during Jeff Wayne's War of the Worlds project.
